description: Allows the operator to specify the source container or lot, the target quantity per destination container, and to designate either the number of destination containers or to dispense until the source container is empty. Supports optional verification of the source container, account assignment, and exception recording.
intent: To configure and record the dispensing (aliquoting) of material from a source container into one or more target containers as defined by the recipe, capturing all necessary details for traceability and downstream processing.

conditions: Source container or lot must be available
If lot-tracked contains multiple materials, a valid Material ID must be entered
SUPPORT_LOT_EQ_CONT_ALLOC parameter configuration applies for container-tracked material

preconditions: Phase has been authored and configured with Instructions and Confirmation Type
Valid Container ID is entered and material/lot information is loaded
Material ID determined or specified if required
Source area/location selected for lot-tracked material when stored in multiple locations
example_usage: Operator scans container C123, enters Required Quantity = 50 g, selects UOM = "g", sets Number of Containers = 2, then clicks Finish. The system dispenses 100 g (50 g Ã— 2) into two destination containers and sets batch variables (e.g., DISP_BATCH_ID, CONTAINER_ID, LOT_ID, DISPENSE_MATL, ACCOUNT1, etc.).
